titleStmt.title: Boni ominis votum: a good omen to the next Parliament, expressed upon occasion of those extraordinary grand juries, lately summoned out of the most eminent baronets, knights, esquires, and gentlemen, in some counties, to serve at the summer assises, this year, 1656. / By a faithfull servant to this republick.
titleStmt.author: Wither, George, 1588-1667.

publicationStmt.publisher: Printed for John Hardesty, at the black Spread-Eagle in Duck Lane, or at his shop in the Strand nigh Worcester House.,

notesStmt.note: Faithfull servant to this republick = George Wither; signed at end: Geo. Wither.
A congratulary poem on the Parliament of 1656. Cf. DNB.
Annotation on Thomason copy: "By George Wither master of ye statute office given him by ye Lord Protector lately".
Reproduction of the original in the British Library.

place.placeName: the black Spread-Eagle in Duck Lane, or at his shop in the Strand nigh Worcester House.
